title: Microscopy and Characterization Suite – a Facility Designed for Post-Irradiation-Examination
content: Microscopy and Characterization Suite (MaCS) at Center for Advanced Energy Studies (CAES) is a multi-user and core facility for both academy and industry, with its majority activities towards providing post-irradiation-examination (PIE) capabilities for researches supported by Nuclear Science User Facilities (NSUF). Nuclear energy is a clean and affordable energy source that contributes to greenhouse gas reduction goals as a key component of the nation’s energy portfolio. NSUF is managed by Idaho National Laboratory (INL) for USDOE, provides unparalleled research opportunities for nuclear energy researchers, and the PIE is a key step to reveal the relationship among material’s property, chemistry and performance in researches for future nuclear reactor’s materials design.
